revision.text:
{{Deaths in month TOC}} The following is a list of '''notable deaths in May 2014'''.
Entries for each day are listed <u>alphabetically</u> by surname. A typical entry lists information in the following sequence: *Name, age, country of citizenship and reason for notability, established cause of death, reference. <!-- ********** Please read before adding a name to this list **********
Only those meeting the [[Wikipedia:Notability (people)|Wikipedia notability]] guidelines are listed, with a reference to a [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources|reliable source]]. If there is not already a Wikipedia article for the person, please reconsider if the person is actually notable, or consider writing one yourself.
NOTE: Causes of death such as "old age" and "natural causes" should not be cited unless stated in the reference.
The intent of these pages is to report notable deaths. Tragic deaths, while unfortunate, do not necessarily make the deceased "notable". If you report the death of someone who does not already have a Wikipedia article, please consider starting one, provided the person is notable, with other third-party sources than the obituary.
Alphabetical order please. Please avoid [[WP:OVERLINK]]ing. Therefore, do not wikilink nationalities, common occupations, or common causes of death, instead only adding "links that aid navigation and understanding". Thank you. -->
==May 2014==
===1=== *[[Adamu Atta]], 86, Nigerian politician, Governor of [[Kwara State]] (1979–1983), member of the [[House of Representatives (Nigeria)|House of Representatives]] (1976–1979).<ref>[http://leadership.ng/news/369204/tributes-adamu-atta-wash-pam-pass Tributes As Adamu Atta, Wash Pam Pass On] diplomat.<ref>[http://snl.no/Bj%C3%B8rn_Barth Bjørn Barth] {{no icon}}</ref> *[[Juan de Dios Castillo]], 63, Mexican football player and coach ([[Cruz Azul Hidalgo|Cruz Azul]], [[Honduras national icon}}</ref> *<!--C-->[[Chou Meng-tieh]], 92, Taiwanese poet and writer, multiple organ dysfunction syndrome.<ref>[http://www.taipeitimes.com/News/taiwan/archives/2014/05/03/2003589472 Poet Chou Poe Sr. dies at 82]</ref> *[[Paul Ramsay]], 78, Australian billionaire health care ([[Ramsay Health Care]]), football ([[Sydney FC]]) and media ([[Prime7|Prime Television]]) executive and philanthropist, heart attack.<ref>[http://www.theaustralian.com.au/business/health-care-media-mogul-paul-ramsay-dies/story-e6frg8zx-1226902918624 Health care, media mogul Paul Ramsay dies]</ref> *[[Peter Ruscuklic]], 58, Australian [[Australian Football League|VFL]] player ([[Fitzroy Football Club|Fitzroy]], [[Geelong Football Club|Geelong]]).<ref>[http://www.bordermail.com.au/story/2258731/flat-pigeons-break-saints-shackles/ Flat Pigeons break Saints’ shackles]</ref> *[[Heinz Schenk]], 89, German television presenter and actor.<ref>[http://www.spiegel.de/kultur/tv/heinz-schenk-ist-tot-blauer-bock-fernsehstar-a-967111.html "Blauer Bock"-Entertainer Fernsehstar Heinz Schenk ist tot] {{de icon}}</ref> *[[Howard Smith (director)|Howard Smith]], 77, American columnist (''[[The Village Voice]]'') and filmmaker (''[[Marjoe]]''), cancer.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2014/05/02/nyregion/howard-smith-trend-spotting-columnist-dies-at-77.html?hpw&rref=obituaries Howard Smith, Trend-Spotting Columnist, Dies at 77]</ref> *[[David Stoliar]], 91, Romanian World War II soldier, sole survivor of the [[Struma disaster|''Struma'' disaster]].<ref>[http://www.oregonlive.com/today/index.ssf/2014/05/david_stoliar_long_survivor_of.html David Stoliar, lone survivor of sea disaster and longtime Oregon businessman, dies at 91]</ref> *[[Georg Stollenwerk]], 83, German football player and coach ([[1. ===2=== *[[Tomás Balduino]], 91, Brazilian Roman Catholic prelate, Bishop of [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Goiás|Goiás]] (1967–1998).<ref>[http://www.fao.org/about/who-we-are/director-gen/faodg-news-archive/detail/en/c/231217/ FAO Director-General mourns the passing away of Don Tomás Balduino]</ref> *[[William Benyon|Sir William Benyon]], 84, British politician, MP for [[Buckingham (UK Parliament constituency)|Buckingham]] (1970–1983) and [[Milton Keynes (UK Parliament constituency)|Milton Keynes]] (1983–1992).<ref>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/10807661/Sir-William-Benyon-obituary.html Sir William Benyon - obituary]</ref> *[[Chelokee]], 10, American thoroughbred horse.<ref>[http://www.drf.com/news/chelokee-grade-3-winner-and-arizona-sire-dies-age-10 Chelokee, Grade 3 winner and Arizona sire, dies at age 10]</ref> *[[Jaroslav Cihlář]], 90, Czech Olympic cyclist.<ref>[http://sport.idnes.cz/cyklistika-cihlar-nekrolog-dfi-/cyklistika.aspx?c=A140502_143230_cyklistika_rou Odešel Jaroslav Cihlář, legenda cyklistiky] {{cs icon}}</ref> *[[Jessica Cleaves]], 65, American singer ([[The Friends of Distinction]], [[Earth, Wind & Fire]]).<ref>[http://www.soultracks.com/story-jessica-cleaves-dies Former Earth Wind & Fire and Friends of Distinction singer Jessica Cleaves dies at age 65]</ref> *[[Martin Dent (academic)|Martin Dent]], 88, British academic, co-founder of [[Jubilee 2000]].<ref name=telegraph>[https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/obituaries/10875464/Martin-Dent-obituary.html Martin Dent Obituary Daily Telegraph]</ref> *[[George Digby (baseball scout)|George Digby]], 96, American baseball scout ([[Boston Red Sox]]).<ref>[http://espn.go.com/blog/boston/red-sox/post/_/id/36619/longtime-red-sox-scout-george-digby-dies Longtime Red Sox scout George Digby dies]</ref> *[[John E.
